subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: A CJK {{w|Unicode compatibility characters|compatibility ideograph}} (U+2F8D5) exists with [[曰]] as the bottom component instead of [[日]].

subSections.title: Derived characters
subSections.text: * {{l|mul|[[𧭘]]/[[譜]]}}, {{l|mul|普}} (and its [[普#Derived_characters|derived characters]]), {{l|mul|替}} (and its [[替#Derived_characters|derived characters]])

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text: {{zh-see|替|a}} <!--《廣韻·去聲·霽·替》替：『廢也，代也，滅也。《說文》本作暜廢一偏下也。他計切，二十。』-->

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text: {{zh-see|普|a}} <!--《康熙字典》普：『《唐韻》滂古切，音浦。《說文》作暜，日無色也。《註》日無光則遠近皆同，故从竝。』-->

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: Note that etymology 1 applies to the character with [[曰]] as the bottom component (U+2F8D5) while etymology 2 applies to the character with [[日]] as the bottom component (U+669C). When {{w|regular script}} ([[楷書]]) became the more prominent style in {{w|Chinese script styles|Chinese calligraphy}}, the component [[竝]] in 暜 was simplified to [[替]] and [[普]] respectively to avoid confusion between the two forms.

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: This character was added to {{w|JIS X 0208}} in 1990 but is scarcely used except in historical texts.
